description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>JOB SUMMARY</strong><p><br></p>The Sales Data Analyst will support the processes and systems related to servicing our customers and supporting our sales team. This will require gathering information from a variety of sources including Salesforce.com, EPM, finance records and other areas and provide expert analytical support which translates into the development of dashboards that convert the raw data into information that is actionable. The role also includes the development our analytical and reporting capabilities to provide insights into key trends and performance indicators.<p><br></p><strong>The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Data Management</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design and implement processes, dashboards, interactive and automated reports, and data files to manage and maintain clean data.</li><li>Take ownership of these processes and check and adjust them to maintain effectiveness.</li><li>Develop customized reports and dashboards in risks, andopportunities.</li><li>Manage the development and delivery of data products that support forecasting, reporting, and scenario modeling of data.</li><li>Help manage and optimize business processes for data intake, validation, visualization, and communication of deliverables.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Other Duties</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Partner with other S&amp;C data analytics groups to ensure effective delivery of data analysis to business leaders.</li><li>Participate in cross-functional projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities.</li><li>Collaborate with IT group to design solutions that meet business needs.</li><li>Testing support including building out test cases, facilitating business testing scenarios, and documenting issues/resolutions</li><li>Provide to users Salesforce training, skills development, support, and assistance for the use of the dashboard/analytical tools.</li><li>Partner with IT colleagues in a collaborative system for cross functional review/design and initiative-taking communication</li><li>Keep up to date with advances in data analytics technologies.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience</li><li>Firsthand experience with CRM Software and advanced MS Office skills (Excel, Word, PowerPoint), familiarity with databases (Microsoft Access)</li><li>Knowledge of Salesforce.com and Einstein Analytics is an asset.</li><li>Excellent organizational, prioritization and multi-tasking skills</li><li>Analytical with excellent problem solving and critical thinking skills.</li><li>Must be adaptable to changing business needs.</li><li>A collaborator with prominent level of dedication</li><li>Initiative-taking and resourceful</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills </li><li>Must have strong attention to detail</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>In 1909, S&amp;C Electric Company transformed the delivery of safe, reliable electricity with the invention of the Liquid Power Fuse. Today, as the world faces extreme weather events and the demand for electricity grows, S&amp;C continues to innovate and advance the electrical grid, ensuring reliable and resilient power for homes, communities, and critical infrastructure around the world.<p><br></p>With a diverse, global workforce and core values around integrity, safety, and quality, S&amp;C is a trusted industry leader and top workplace that offers meaningful careers to more than 3,500 team members. As a people-first organization, S&amp;C is committed to fostering an inclusive and collaborative workplace where team members advance their careers through robust talent-development programs and involved leadership.<p><br></p>S&amp;C’s deeply rooted belief diversity fosters greater creativity, innovation, and success guides the company to advance and sustain a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace culture.<p><br></p><strong>Organization</strong><p><br></p>On the Sales team, we work with our customers to help them adopt innovative and ground-breaking technology that revolutionizes the electrical industry. We're recognized as one of the best sales teams in the industry, not only because we go the extra mile for our customers, but because we bring technical savvy, industry experience, and hands-on expertise to the job. We're on the ground with our customers and can see first-hand how we're transforming the grid together.<p><br></p>

description: At Coinbase, our mission is to increase economic freedom around the world, and we couldn’t do this without hiring the best people. Know those people who always lead the group project? That’s us.<p><br></p>There are a few things we look for across all hires we make at Coinbase, regardless of role or team. First, we look for candidates who will thrive in a culture like ours, where we default to trust, embrace feedback, and disrupt ourselves. Second, we expect all employees to commit to our mission-focused approach to our work. Finally, we seek people who are excited to learn about and live crypto, because those are the folks who enjoy the intense moments in our sprint and recharge work culture. We’re a remote-first company looking to hire the absolute best talent all over the world.<p><br></p><strong>Ready to #LiveCrypto? Who you are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. </li><li>You’re never tired of learning. You want to be a pro in bleeding edge tech like DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and Web 3.0. </li><li>You appreciate direct communication. You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener - because let’s face it, you can’t have one without the other. You’re cool with candid feedback and see every setback as an opportunity to grow.</li><li>You can pivot on the fly. Crypto is constantly evolving, so our priorities do, too. What you worked on last month may not be what you work on today, and that excites you. You’re not looking for a boring job.</li><li>You have a “can do” attitude. Our teams create high-quality work on quick timelines. Owning a problem doesn’t scare you, but rather empowers you to take 100% responsibility for achieving our mission.</li><li>You want to be part of a winning team. We’re stronger together, and you’re a person who embraces being pushed out of your comfort zone. </li></ul><p><br></p>Data Science is an integral component of Coinbase’s product and decision making process: we work in partnership with Product, Engineering and Design to influence the roadmap and better understand our users. With a deep expertise in experimentation, analytics and advanced modeling, we produce insights which directly move the company’s bottom line.<p><br></p>Specifically, we’re looking for a Staff Data Scientist to join our Retail Trading Team. Job Duties)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Act as a strategic partner and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to develop pricing experiment hypotheses</li><li>Design and implement multiple pricing experiments simultaneously and evaluate results to determine the optimal pricing strategy</li><li>Explore advanced experiment techniques such as small sample enhancements, Bayesian approaches and apply them successfully for complex experiments </li><li>Develop frameworks to facilitate decision-making around metric trade-offs, particularly when they involve multiple organizations</li><li>Aggregate learnings to inform the pricing framework, principles, and future decisions</li><li>Synthesize data learnings into compelling stories and communicate them throughout Coinbase and to senior executives</li><li>Initiate, develop, and maintain data pipelines and data models with outstanding craftsmanship </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What We Look For In You (ie. Job Requirements)</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Demonstration of our core cultural values: clear communication, positive energy, continuous learning, and efficient execution.</li><li>PhD in Statistics, Economics or a related field</li><li>Minimum 5 years of experience in pricing experimentation, data analysis and statistical modeling</li><li>Strong proficiency in SQL, Python, R, or other programming languages used for data analysis and statistical modeling</li><li>Ability to independently create plans for analytics projects and a track record of overseeing large / complex analytical projects spanning multiple teams</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex data and analysis to non-technical stakeholders.</li><li>Strong attention to detail and ability to work under tight deadlines</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Haves</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience applying causal inference techniques outside of controlled experiments</li><li>Experience applying causal inference techniques outside of controlled experiments</li></ul><p><br></p>ID: P51651<p><br></p><strong>Pay Transparency Notice:</strong> Depending on your work location, the target annual salary for this position can range as detailed below.
